summary: This bill, the School Meal Modernization and Hunger Elimination Act, aims to broaden access to free and reduced-price school meals. It focuses on improving direct certification processes, including streamlining eligibility for children in foster care, those receiving Medicaid, and those in families experiencing housing insecurity. The bill also includes provisions for retroactive reimbursement, expanding access through the community eligibility option, establishing demonstration projects for universal free meals in select states, and providing grants to improve direct certification rates.
